properties.name: India-Pakistan
properties.min: May have paved the way for MoU between Pakistan FWO and US Strategic Minerals company in September)

properties.name: DRC - Rwanda
properties.min: The "Critical Minerals for Security and Peace Deal " is a US–brokered agreement seeks to stabilize the eastern DRC, and to facilitate cooperation over the extraction and trade of rare earth minerals in exchange for security to offset China’s dominance in this sector. There is a promise to link both countries, in partnership, as appropriate, with the U.S. government and U.S. investors” in the context of “regional critical-mineral supply chains

properties.name: Armenia - Azerbaijan
properties.min: Establishes the “Trump Route for International Peace and Prosperity” (TRIPP) – a transit corridor through southern Armenia connecting Azerbaijan to Nakhchivan. Development rights for the corridor (rail, oil, gas, fiber, possibly power lines) are granted to the U.S. for 99 years, with the U.S. sub-leasing to a private consortium.

properties.name: Israel-Hamas
properties.min: The components section includes a Trump economic development plan for Gaza and a special economic zone: language talks about convening experts who built “modern miracle cities” in the Gulf, attracting investment, and establishing a special economic zone with preferred tariff and access rates for participating countries.

properties.name: Cambodia-Thailand
properties.min: US signed MoUs on Diversifying Global Critical Minerals Supply Chains with both Malaysia and Thailand on the same day

properties.name: Ukraine-Russia
properties.min: Point 12.a of 28-point plan envisages "a Ukraine Development Fund to invest in fast-growing industries, including technology, data centres, and artificial intelligence." Point 13. b says that Russia and "United States will enter into a long-term economic cooperation agreement for mutual development in the areas of energy, natural resources, infrastructure, artificial intelligence, data centres, rare earth metal extraction projects in the Arctic, and other mutually beneficial corporate opportunities." The counter-proposal written by Europeans later includes "Mineral and natural resource extraction" as a component of a Robust Global Redevelopment Package for Ukraine (point 12.e). The counter-proposal by Ukraine includes a special economic zone open to US business in the Donbas
